titles.title: CB 160 Follow Me
I Traveled Down a Lonely Road

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
I TRAVELED DOWN A LONELY ROAD,
And no one seemed to care. The burden on my
weary back had bowed me to despair. I'd oft
complain to Jesus how folks were treating me,
and then I heard Him say so tenderly:

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
"My feet were also weary upon the Calvary road;
that cross became so heavy, I fell beneath the
load. Have patience weary pilgrim, the morning I
can see, just lift that cross and follow close to Me."

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
I've worked so hard for Jesus, I'd oft complain and
say, "I've sacrificed a lot of things to walk this
narrow way. I gave up fame and fortune, Lord, I'm
worth a lot to Thee," and then I heard Him gently
say to me:

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
"I left the throne of glory and counted it but loss;
My hands were nailed in anger upon that cruel
cross. So now let's make that journey with your
hand safe in Mine. Just lift that cross and follow
close to Me."
